title: Prova
text:
Prova is an <a href="open%20source">open source</a> <a href="programming%20language">programming language</a> that combines <a href="Prolog">Prolog</a> with <a href="Java%20%28programming%20language%29">Java</a>.
Description.
Prova is a rule-based <a href="Scripting%20language">scripting</a> system that is used for <a href="middleware">middleware</a>. The language combines <a href="imperative%20programming">imperative</a> and <a href="declarative%20programming">declarative programming</a> by using a prolog syntax that allows calls to Java functions. In this way a strong Java code base is combined with Prolog features such as backtracking.
Prova is derived from Mandarax, a Java-based <a href="inference">inference</a> system developed by <a href="Jens%20Dietrich">Jens Dietrich</a>. Prova extends Mandarax by providing a proper language <a href="syntax">syntax</a>, native syntax integration with Java, <a href="agent%20messaging">agent messaging</a> and <a href="reaction%20rules">reaction rules</a>. The development of this language was supported by the grant provided within the EU projects GeneStream and BioGRID. In the project, the language is used as a rule-based backbone for distributed <a href="web%20applications">web applications</a> in biomedical <a href="data%20integration">data integration</a>, in particular, the <a href="GoPubMed">GoPubMed</a> system.
The design goals of Prova:
Prova aims to provide support for data integration tasks when the following is important:
Prova has been used as the key service integration engine in the <a href="Xcalia">Xcalia</a> product where it is used for computing efficient global execution plans across multiple data sources such as Web services, TP monitors transactions like <a href="CICS">CICS</a> or <a href="IBM%20Information%20Management%20System">IMS</a>, messages of MOM like <a href="MQ-Series">MQ-Series</a>, packaged applications with a <a href="Java%20EE%20Connector%20Architecture">JCA connector</a>, legacy data sources on mainframes with a JCA connector, remote EJB Java objects considered as data providers or even local Java objects. Prova allows to deliver an innovative software platform for <a href="Service-oriented%20architecture">Service-oriented architecture</a> implementations.
